Title: 2026: Southwest PDP denies endorsing Oyebanji for second term
Summary: The Peoples Democratic Party (PDP) South West zone has stated that the party has no pact with the Governor of Ekiti State, Mr Biodun Oyebanji, regarding support for his second-term election . This was just as the party boasted that it would be in power in 2026 .

Title: Ex-NBA president resists AGF’s attempt to discontinue firm’s trial
Summary: Joseph B. Daudu (SAN) urged a Lagos State High Court in Ikeja to reject an attempt by the Minister of Justice and Attorney General of the Federation, Lateef Fagbemi (SAN), to discontinue firm's trial .

Title: DSS witness links Nnamdi Kanu to attacks on Gulak, security officers
Summary: A witness from the Department of State Services (DSS) told the Federal High Court in Abuja that the activities of the Indigenous People of Biafra (IPOB) and its armed wing, the Eastern Security Network (ESN), resulted in the attacks on Gulak, security officers .

Title: Plateau lauds foundation for supporting educational access
Summary: Plateau State government commended Oando Foundation over its commitment to reintegrate out-of-school children through its innovative LEARNOVATE Foundational Learning Improvement Programme (FLIP) initiative . Plateau lauds foundation for supporting educational access .

Title: Goalkeeper Garcia joins Barca from local rivals Espanyol
Summary: Barcelona have signed Espanyol goalkeeper Joan Garcia for 26.34 million euros ($31 million) Garcia, 24, had originally joined Barca’s local rivals as a teenager and kept eight clean sheets in 38 appearances .

Title: Delta Govt addressing Ndokwa electricity challenge – Aniagwu
Summary: Delta Govt says it has intensified efforts to resolve electricity challenge in Ndokwa Nation . Commissioner for Works (Rural Roads) and Public Information, Mr. Charles Aniagwu, assured residents that concrete steps are being taken to resolve the problem .

Title: Oil Revenue: Reps to sanction 13 companies over $4.9billion debt to FG
Summary: The House of Representatives Public Accounts Committee (PAC) has vowed to sanction 13 non-compliant companies over an alleged debt of $456,952,216.51 to the Nigerian government in unremitted oil revenues . …as recovered funds reach N86.5bn .

Title: Again, troops neutralize scores of Boko Haram terrorists in Borno
Summary: 'Operation Hadin Kai' comprised of land, maritime, and air components . The troops of Theatre Command North East have killed scores of Boko Haram terrorists in Borno .

Title: Air Peace Chairman decries ‘targeted campaign’ against airline
Summary: Chairman of Nigeria’s largest carrier, Air Peace, Allen Onyema, lamented what he described as an orchestrated campaign against the airline . He urged Nigerians to jettison the pull-him-down syndrome . His statement came amid a series of heated exchanges between Air Peace management and former governor of Edo State, Adams

Title: Nigeria, Brazil to sign 30 MoUs on defence, agriculture, others
Summary: Federal Government is set to sign more than 30 Memoranda of Understanding (MoUs) as Nigeria prepares to host the second session of the Nigeria-Brazil Strategic Dialogue Mechanism (SDM) Nigeria, Brazil to sign MoUs on defence, agriculture, others .

Title: ‘We can’t farm without getting killed’, Benue women protest killings
Summary: A group of women stormed the Government House in Makurdi on Wednesday . They carried placards with various inscriptions urging President Bola Tinubu to end banditry . The women also sang dirges in their local dialect and expressed their anguish over the worsening security situation .

Title: Benue killings: ‘This is genocide, not a dispute’, Tor Tiv tells Tinubu
Summary: The Tor Tiv V, James Ayatse, has told President Bola Tinubu that the killings in Benue State are not clashes between herders and farmers, but a planned attack aimed at taking over land . He described the violence as a “calculated, well-planned, full-scale genocidal invasion

Title: Reps threaten to sanction 13 oil firms over $456m unpaid revenue
Summary: The companies are allegedly owing the Federal Government about $456.95m (N731.12 bn) in unremitted revenues . The House of Representatives Public Accounts Committee on Wednesday warned 13 non-compliant oil companies to appear before it to answer questions in the ongoing probe of non-remittance of monies due to the

Title: 17 million Nigerians traveled abroad in 2023 - NANTA
Summary: The National Association of Nigerian Travel Agencies said over 17 million Nigerians travelled out between 2023 and 2024 . This is as the association announced that it would be organising a maiden edition of Eastern Travel Market 2025 in Uyo, Akwa Ibom State capital from 27th to 30th August, 2025 . Title: EFCC arrests ex-Plateau Speaker, 14 others over alleged N2.5bn scam
Summary: The Economic and Financial Crimes Commission has arrested a former Speaker of the Plateau State House of Assembly, Moses Thomas Sule, alongside 14 former lawmakers, over allegations of money laundering and abuse of office . The suspects were arrested by operatives of the EFCC’s Makurdi Zonal Directorate on June 17, 2025, following petitions
